reviews.review: He is a very harsh grader and barely explains. His class is useless and his slides don’t even cover enough information. Do not take him!

He's a nice guy and the class itself is not very hard. However, he is an extremely harsh grader (not a single person in the class got a 100 on any assignment) and there are not very many grades. If you are looking for a free A DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS

name: AASP298C
title: African-American History to 1865
description: Cross-listed with: HIST254. Credit only granted for: HIST254 or AASP298C. Survey of the principal developments in the history and culture of the peoples of African descent in colonial North America and the United States to 1865. Examines the African past, the Atlantic slave trade, variation in slavery, the growth of free black communities, the transformations of families and cultural forms, and patterns of resistance.
